intro: Didymopanax malmei, commonly known as the Malme's sycoglossum, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are followed by fleshy, red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, humid environments within the understory of forests. Due to its unique foliage and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
